news.title: Simon Harris in power grab to stave off any Fine Gael threats to his leadership
news.summary: Tánaiste Simon Harris has moved to consolidate his power in the Government as the next Finance Minister and stave off any future leadership threat.

news.title: EU could hand the North special status to ‘prepare for Irish reunification’
news.summary: Politicians in the North could be reintroduced into the European Parliament in preparation for a united Ireland.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Promoting himself shows Simon Harris doesn’t trust Fine Gael ministers to be competent – or not to undermine him
news.summary: Irreplaceable. Paschal Donohoe’s departure as finance minister highlights the paucity of talent in Fine Gael.

news.title: Sam Prendergast or Jack Crowley v South Africa? Whoever starts will say a lot about Andy Farrell’s future plans
news.summary: Jack Crowley and Sam Prendergast got the full ROG/Sexton-cam experience during last weekend’s win over Australia.

news.title: Tears from Epstein’s alleged victims as House of Representatives votes to release the files
news.summary: The Republican-controlled US House of Representatives voted almost unanimously yesterday to force the release of Justice Department files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, an outcome president Donald Trump had fought for months before ending his opposition.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: World Cups, Westlife and another lefty woman in the Áras – set the sat-nav for the Walkinstown roundabout and party like it’s 1990!
news.summary: So often cultural ­nostalgia is about selling something. A fashion trend that you were relieved to see go the first time round gets recycled and the kids all decide to wear it, just to spite the rest of us.

news.title: Ask a money coach: ‘Do I have to contribute 50/50 to my stepchildren’s holidays?’
Carenting: Three Irish people who care for elderly parents on the mental, physical and financial toll – and their advice to others
news.summary: There are currently more than 500,000 people looking after a parent or loved one in Ireland. Parents look after their children until they fly the nest, then the roles are reversed.

news.title: Today FM presenter Matt Cooper: ‘People who don’t know me make a lot of assumptions based on social media’
news.summary: Matt Cooper is a journalist, podcaster and author from Co Cork. He writes a column for the Business Post and hosts The Last Word on Today FM. He lives in Co Dublin with is wife Aileen and children.

news.title: More people in Ireland seeking help for ‘very restricted eating’, says Bodywhys
news.summary: More than a quarter of calls made to a support organisation last year involved people who had an ­eating disorder for over 10 years.
